Chris,

We decided to make JUnit 4 Java 1.5-specific so we could take advantage of
the new language features. We felt confident in doing this because 1) we
already have a stable, accepted product in JUnit 3.8.1 and 2) the adoption
curve suggests that most of the early adopters of JUnit will also be early
adopters of Java. Unfortunately, this leaves some like you who sound like
you would like to be early JUnit adopters but can't move to Java 1.5 stuck
on the old version of JUnit. I can't think of a simple way to make JUnit 4
work with Java 1.4, though.

Yours in asymmetrical upgrades,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

>
